meanings.definition: A unit of dry measure equal to 32 quarts.
meanings.sent1: She bought three bushels of apples at the market.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested many bushels of corn this season.
meanings.sent3: Carrying bushels of potatoes made her arms ache.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as abundant as bushels of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The barn was filled with the sweet scent of bushels of hay.

meanings.sent1: He had bushels of energy after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: The students collected bushels of leaves for the project.
meanings.sent3: She had bushels of fun at the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: The singer received bushels of applause after the performance.
meanings.sent5: The library had bushels of books waiting to be read.
